content.title: Profunda Femoris Artery Disease
content.definition: Atherosclerotic disease of the deep femoral artery (profunda femoris), which serves as critical collateral supply to the lower extremity when superficial femoral artery is occluded.

anatomy.collateral_role: Primary route around SFA occlusion via genicular network

pathophysiology.pattern: Often in conjunction with CFA disease

clinical_significance.collateral_capacity: Can compensate for complete SFA occlusion
clinical_significance.when_diseased: Severe claudication or rest pain even with patent inflow

profundaplasty.definition: Extension of endarterectomy or patch into profunda origin

isolated_profundaplasty.indication: Claudication with proximal PFA disease, no reconstruction options

with_bypass.indication: PFA often used as bypass outflow
with_bypass.technique: Anastomosis to common or deep portion

outcomes.limb_salvage: Excellent when combined with inflow correction

learning_objectives: Recognize the collateral importance of profunda femoris
Apply profunda assessment in PAD evaluation
clinical_pearls: A good profunda can save a limb with SFA occlusion
Always extend CFA endarterectomy into profunda if diseased
Profunda-based collaterals are key to claudication severity
